text: the Iraqi army still has a strong
presence around Baghdad even though it's
capitulated all too easily in other
parts of the country but as we drove
north towards the front line with the
protection of Shia militia the
checkpoints were being man by their
fighters we met their jubilant forces on
the outskirts of Baku BER about 50 miles
from the capital a mix of regular and
irregular troops many belonging to the
banner Brigade a group with close links
to Iran they were celebrating recent
gains on the battlefield against the
Sunni extremists as Mohammed we fought
them and we killed 40 Isis fighters
nationally on not that we consider today
to be the countdown for Isis to leave
our cities for good there's been heavy
fighting in and around back uber
government forces have so far had few
victories to celebrate but they released
this video which they say shows their
successes against Isis outside the city
and the weapons they've seized and this
is the ground they've recently taken the
closest yet journalists have come to the
fighting near the capital they brought
in tanks and a dug themselves in
preparing for another potential Isis
offensive Isis have already taken a
little bit of towns here in Diyala
province and this was one area that they
captured it's now held though my Shia
militia but we can still hear a gunfire
from these positions on the ISIS forces
and in the distance there was the sound
of small arms fire suggesting that Isis
has not given up on its promised advance
on Baghdad the man coordinating the
fight back is Hadiya Mary he's supposed
to be Iraq's Minister of Transport but
he's now dressed for combat he also
heads the battered Brigade and says
he'll turn to his friends in Iran if
America doesn't provide air strikes
along with them at the moment if the
United States doesn't support us we'll
turn to anyone and that's why we've made
it clear that if America doesn't step in
we'll ask for assistance from Iran Iraqi
forces with the help of Shia militia are
making a stand around back uber but that
doesn't hide the fact that elsewhere in
the country they're still in retreat
door 'litham via BBC News Baghdad
